subject: Education
title: Analogical Reasoning: Bridges Between Domains
description: A short lesson to help you apply Analogical Reasoning: Bridges Between Domains.

hook.text: A doctor solved a tumor problem by thinking about how armies siege a fortress.

buildup.text: Analogies map structures from a known domain to an unfamiliar one.

discovery.text: Gick and Holyoak showed people rarely use analogies unless explicitly prompted.

twist.text: Giving two analogies instead of one dramatically increases spontaneous transfer.

climax.text: The key is extracting the underlying principle, not just surface similarities.

punchline.text: A good analogy is a shortcut through the unknown.

quiz.question: What did Gick and Holyoak discover about analogies?
options: People rarely use analogies spontaneously without prompting
One analogy is always sufficient for transfer
